definition: to spoil/to mess up
lane/alley
to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with
dregs/draff/pickled in wine/rotten/messy/ruined

sentences.english: Our travel arrangements have been buggered up by the ticket office.
sentences.chinese: 我們的旅行安排被售票處弄糟了。

sentences.english: Just a little bit in a dressing spoils the whole salad?
sentences.chinese: 僅僅調料汁裏的一點點就弄糟了一整盤色拉？

sentences.english: She said, 'Don't mess up my body make -up .
sentences.chinese: 她說，“別把我身上的妝弄糟。

sentences.english: If he undertakes anything he always messes it up.
sentences.chinese: 他要是做什麼事情就總是把它弄糟。

sentences.english: The funding was withdrawn after they botched up the first stage of the research.
sentences.chinese: 他們把第一階段的研究工作弄糟之後，資金被收回了。
這小子把一切事情都弄糟了。

sentences.english: Mom spoiled the soup with too much salt.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽擱了太多的鹽，把湯給弄糟了。

sentences.english: The defence case was wrecked by the defendant's behaviour in court.
sentences.chinese: 辯護方的案子被被告在法庭上的行爲弄糟。

sentences.english: You have spoiled the whole thing.; You have made a mess of the job.
He contrived to make a mess of the whole thing。
sentences.chinese: 他挖空心思反而把事情全盤弄糟了。

sentences.english: The pilots' strike messed up our holiday.
sentences.chinese: 火車誤點，把我們的計劃的全弄糟了。

sentences.english: I don't wanna mess it up.
sentences.chinese: 我是不想把事情弄糟了。

sentences.english: If you do mess up, admit it and move on.
sentences.chinese: 如果你真的把事情弄糟了，承認之，然後繼續。

sentences.english: This is the place to place pictures from all over wikipedia without messing up my lookup. Gallery is inspired by that of MykReeve's gallery.
sentences.chinese: 這是地方安置圖片從到處維基百科沒有弄糟我的查尋。

sentences.english: How can I ever make amend for ruin their party?
sentences.chinese: 我把他們的聚會弄糟了，這個罪可怎麼賠得起呀？

definition: to bring to deadlock/to result in a stalemate
to mess (sth) up/to foul up/to spoil
to overreach oneself/to try to be clever and end up with egg on one's face
to mess up/to mismanage/to bungle/to confuse/to muddle
to go to extremes/to leave no room for maneuver
to vent one's anger on an innocent party (idiom)
to ruin/to spoil/to break
to waste all one's previous efforts (idiom)/all that has been achieved goes down the drain
irremediable/unmanageable/out of hand/hopeless
to banish from one's thoughts/to ignore/to take no notice
chaos/bungle/complete mess/shambles
irreversible
to produce the opposite of the desired result
to be officious/to kibitz/to be meddlesome/to force one's help upon
to blame
to be more of a hindrance than a help
